body.p: To his Excellency Gov. Thomas. E. Bramlette

Your petitioners respectfully state that at the May term 1865 of the Harrison Circuit Court a judgement for fifty dollars on a forfeited recognizance was rendered against John. L. Shawhan as security for Nancy Buck in the case of the Comlth vs her on a charge of larceny: Nancy is a free woman of color & was raised in Mr Shawhans family: after she had executed bond for her appearance at the Nov. term 1864 of the Harrison Circuit Court she left the state & her bond was forfeited it is represented & your petitioners believe truly that she was forced to leave by some negro soldiers who were very active about that time in sending off contrabands Mr Shawhan is a highly respectable good citizen of this county -- a Kind hearted honorable gentleman & your petitioners believe his to be a case for the proper exercise of Executive clemency they therefore respectfully ask that said forfeiture may be remitted

Alex Kimbrugh
J. S. Withers
J S Boyd
T. J. Mcgibben
C. Walton
M. L. Broadwell P. J. H. C.
Lewis Day
B. F. Humphrey
John Rater
Henry Williams
James Frazer
H Rowland
J Levi Patterson
J. R. Megee
John McKee
G. Remington
Chas. T. Wilson Clk Co Ct
J. F. Ware
c H. Circt Court

Cynthiana June 24th/65
Gov. Thos. E. Bramlette

Dr Sir enclosed I send copy jdgt. Harrison Circuit Court & ptn for remission of same in case of Comlth vs Buck &c I know Mr Shawhan well & take pleasure in saying that he is a most estimable gentleman. I hope his ptn. will receive your favorable consideration

Harrison Cir Ct
vs
John L. Shawhan
$50,
